details.Introduction: Italian polymath worked in varied media over 60 years of activity. He was known for his paintings of indexed imagery and films created from found footage. He was a mentee of Marcel Duchamp.
details.Roles: Artist, Cinematographer, Collagist, Genre Artist, Painter, Video Artist
details.Name: Gianfranco Baruchello

details.Roles: Artist, Manufacturer, Engraver, Etcher, Linocutter, Painter, Lecturer, Pastelist, Pastellist, Sculptor
details.Names: Georg Baselitz, Georg Kern, Hans-Georg Baselitz, Hans-Georg Kern, Georg Dern, G. Baselitz, Hans Georg Kern

details.Introduction: Hernan Bas (born 1978 in Miami, Florida, United States) is an artist based in Miami, Florida. He graduated in 1996 from the New World School of the Arts in Miami.Bas is  known for his depictions of waifs and dandies, who are somewhat based on his own experiences, as well as his work with the material SlimFast and the paranormal. Overtime, Bas says, these characters have grown in his paintings and taken on different roles.  Bas is gay and queerness often influences his work in the form of waifs and other young men, typically recurrent characters in his work.Bas owns a building in Detroit that was renovated by Nicola Kuperus and Adam Lee Miller, the couple behind Detroit electronic music act Adult. The building is on a block called Service Street noted for the number of diverse and accomplished artists that work there, including techno music pioneer Derrick May.
details.Name: Hernan Bas

details.Introduction: Antonia Christina Basilotta (born September 22, 1943), better known by her stage name Toni Basil, is an American singer, choreographer, dancer, actress, and director. Her song "Mickey" topped the charts in the US, Canada and Australia and hit the top ten in several other countries.

Leonard Baskin (August 15, 1922 – June 3, 2000) was an American sculptor, draughtsman and graphic artist, as well as founder of the Gehenna Press (1942–2000). One of America's first fine arts presses, it went on to become "one of the most important and comprehensive art presses of the world", often featuring the work of celebrated poets, such as Sylvia Plath, Ted Hughes, Anthony Hecht, and James Baldwin side by side with Baskin's  bold, stark, energetic and often dramatic black-and-white prints. Called a "Sculptor of Stark Memorials" by the New York Times, Baskin is also known for his wood, limestone, bronze, and large-scale woodblock prints, which ranged from naturalistic to fanciful, and were frequently grotesque, featuring bloated figures or humans merging with animals. "His monumental bronze sculpture, The Funeral Cortege, graces the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial in Washington, D.C."
details.Roles: Artist, Art Collector, Engraver, Collector, Illustrator, Sculptor
details.Name: Leonard Baskin

details.Introduction: American painter and draftsman rapidly rose to fame in the 1980s with his graffiti and more conventional paintings on canvas and paper. While still unknown, he would spray paint cryptic phrases on buildings under the name 'Samo'. Basquiat's paintings and drawings were influenced by commercial art and popular imagery. He frequently used textual elements in his work that provided social commentary based on stereotypical black images and events. In 1983 he met Andy Warhol, with whom he collaborated. Basquiat died of a drug overdose in 1988. American artist.
details.Roles: Artist, Graffiti Artist, Cartoonist, Muralist, Musician, Collagist, Illustrator, Installation Artist, Painter, Sculptor
details.Names: Jean-Michel Basquiat, Samo, Jean Michel Basquiat, Jean-Michael Basquiat, SAMO

details.Introduction: Bass' best known work remains the title designs he produced for various Hollywood films, album covers, and logo designs, including the Getty square wordmark.
details.Roles: Artist, Film Director, Designer, Typographer, Graphic Designer, Commercial Artist, Photographer
details.Name: Saul Bass

details.Introduction: Prolific writer produced novels, criticism, poems, economic and political treatises, and philosophical and anthropological essays. He embraced transgressive and erotic subject matter, and founded several journals and literary groups in his lifetime. He edited the journal Documents from 1929-1930, which aimed to push Surrealist ideology, and though he was initially drawn to the Surrealist group, Bataille soon fell out with André Breton.
details.Roles: Artist, Author, Librarian, Writer, Editor, Philosopher, Poet
details.Names: Georges Bataille, George Bataille, Pierre Angélique, Lord Auch, Joruju Bataiyu, G. Bataiyu
